The classification of antidepressants is imperfect and is based on their supposed mechanism of action. The most commonly used classes and molecules are as follows.

===== Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors [''SRIs''] =====

* Citalopram
* Escitalopram
* Paroxetine
* Sertraline
* Fluoxetine

===== Serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors [''SNRI''] =====

* Venlafaxine
* Duloxetine

===== "Other antidepressants" (with a different pharmacological mechanism) =====

* Vortioxetine
* Mianserin
* Mirtazapine
* Agomelatine

===== Imipraminics =====

* Amitriptyline
* Clomipramine

question.title: Classification of antidepressants
question.description: Which of the following antidepressants is NOT a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI)?

option_b.title: Mirtazapine
option_b.description: An atypical antidepressant with a different mechanism

option_c.title: Agomelatine
option_c.description: A drug with a different pharmacological mechanism
